at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.network

Class ServerConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection.Connection
      • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.network.ServerConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISensorDataListener, java.lang.Runnable

    public class ServerConnection
extends Connection
implements ISensorDataListener, java.lang.Runnable
    This class is used to communicate with a TCP-Server via a TCP-connection and is able to send sensor-data to the server and receive control-data from the server to control the car.
    Listeners are able to register themselves with the ServerConnection to get updated about sending and receiving data as well as connection updates.
    Author:
    Boeck

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      private java.net.InetSocketAddress connectToServer(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
      Tries to connect to the server on the specified IP-address and port and also tries the next two ports.
      private void identify()
      Sends identification information to the TCP-Server every 5 seconds and waits until the TCP-Server has sent back confirmation that the car has been successfully registered with it.
      After a successful registration the car sends a list of its properties.
      private void processMessage(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> decodedDataset)
      Checks the incoming message for control-data and puts it on the controlDataQueue.
      private void processSensorData()
      Sends all immediately available sets of DistanceSensorData on the sensorDataQueue to the TCP-Server.
      private java.lang.String readData()
      Reads a maximum of 500 bytes from the Sockets InputStream, converts it into a String, and returns it.
      If an IOException occurs, the connection is closed and a new connection to the TCP-Server is established, if possible.
      void run()
      Tries to establish a connection with the TCP-Server until it is successful.
      Registers this car on the TCP-Server and sends a list of the cars properties.
      Continuously processes incoming data and sends the cars sensor-data to the TCP-Server.
      If the connection to the TCP-Server is lost at some point, the method will immediately try to reestablish it.
      private void sendId()
      Sends identification information to the TCP-Server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerConnection

        public ServerConnection(java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> controlDataQueue,
                        java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue,
                        java.lang.String serverAddress,
                        int port,
                        long carId,
                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> properties)
        Instantiates a new object of this class with the given parameters, and tries to create a valid InetSocketAddress. If that fails, a default IP-address of 192.168.1.100 and port 6633 are used to connect to the TCP-Server.
        Parameters:
        controlDataQueue - the queue that is used to send ControlData to their corresponding interfaces.
        controlChangeQueue - the queue that is used to signal the main class to change the connection that is currently under control of a specific control-data-set.
        serverAddress - the servers IP-address.
        port - the port on which to connect to the server.
        carId - the ID that the RMCS registers itself with on the Server.
        properties - the list of properties of this car.

    • Method Detail

                         java.lang.String message)
        Description copied from class: Connection
        Updates all registered UIs with the latest status of this connection.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        identifier - the topic of the message.
        message - the message that the UIs should be updated with.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Tries to gracefully close the TCP-Connection.

      • connectToServer

        private void connectToServer()
        Tries to establish a connection with the TCP-Server. If a connection on the specified IP-address cannot be established, the IP-address is incremented by one and a connection is tried to be established again. If the IP-address has been incremented 20 times, it is set back to its initial value and the process starts over until a connection can be established.

      • connectToServer

        private java.net.InetSocketAddress connectToServer(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Tries to connect to the server on the specified IP-address and port and also tries the next two ports. Tries to connect on each of the 3 ports 2 times. If an attempt is successful, the Socket is set up for further use.
        Parameters:
        address - the InetSocketAddress with the IP-address and port that the connection with the server should be established on.
        Returns:
        the InetSocketAddress with the IP-address an port that the connection to the server could be established, or null, if all attempts failed.

      • readData

        private java.lang.String readData()
        Reads a maximum of 500 bytes from the Sockets InputStream, converts it into a String, and returns it.
        If an IOException occurs, the connection is closed and a new connection to the TCP-Server is established, if possible.
        Returns:
        the String that was received, or null, if nothing was received before an IOException occurred (including a simple Timeout).

      • writeToStream

        protected boolean writeToStream(java.lang.String outputMessage)
        Writes a String to the Sockets OutputStream for the connected device to receive it. If an IOException occurs, the connection is closed and a new connection to the TCP-Server is established, if possible.
        Parameters:
        outputMessage - the String that should be sent to the TCP-Server.
        Returns:
        true, if the write to the outputStream was successful, otherwise false.

      • writeFromMapToStream

        protected boolean writeFromMapToStream(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> messageMap)
        Converts a HashMap to a JSON-String and writes a String to the Sockets OutputStream for the connected device to receive it.
        Parameters:
        messageMap - the HashMap that should be converted to a JSON-String and sent to the TCP-Server.
        Returns:
        true, if the write to the outputStream was successful, otherwise false.

        Sends identification information to the TCP-Server.

        Sends a list of this cars properties to the TCP-Server.

        private void identify()
        Sends identification information to the TCP-Server every 5 seconds and waits until the TCP-Server has sent back confirmation that the car has been successfully registered with it.

      • processMessage

        private void processMessage(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> decodedDataset)
        Checks the incoming message for control-data and puts it on the controlDataQueue. Also changes the controlling device to a gamepad, if the phone wants to give up control of the car.
        Parameters:
        decodedDataset - the HashMap that contains the incoming data

      • processSensorData

        private void processSensorData()
        Sends all immediately available sets of DistanceSensorData on the sensorDataQueue to the TCP-Server.

      • run

        public void run()
        Tries to establish a connection with the TCP-Server until it is successful.
        Registers this car on the TCP-Server and sends a list of the cars properties.
        Continuously processes incoming data and sends the cars sensor-data to the TCP-Server.
        If the connection to the TCP-Server is lost at some point, the method will immediately try to reestablish it.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
